item.title: What is my occupation?
item.description:

item.title: Sass(Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets)
item.description:
Install

$ gem install sass
$ sass -v
Sass 3.4.23 (Selective Steve)

Partial Sass files

A partial is simply a Sass file named with a leading underscore. You might name it something like _partial.scss. Sass partials are used with the @import directive.

Sass Command

basic

$ sass style.scss:style.css

with watch option

$ sass --watch style:scss:style:css
$ sass --watch main.scss:main.css

Other

.map file

The .map file is a reverse map for the resulting CSS file, showing where each declaration came from in their original SCSS file. They are used be tools like Chrome’s DevTools when you are viewing the resulting web page. https://teamtreehouse.com/community/when-i-type-sass-watch-it-creates-a-maincssmap-file-not-sure-what-that-is

item.title: Blogging with Org-Mode and Hugo
item.description:
hugo.el

http://www.holgerschurig.de/en/emacs-blog-from-org-to-hugo/

I changed the following parts.

- (setq blog (org-export-as backend t))
+ (setq blog (org-export-as backend))

theme

$ cd themes
$ git clone https://github.com/dldx/hpstr-hugo-theme.git hpstr

write

*ã€€Blogging with Org-Mode and Hugo
   :PROPERTIES:
   :TITLE:    Blogging with Org-Mode and Hugo
   :HUGO_TAGS: hugo, emacs
   :HUGO_TOPICS: tech
   :HUGO_FILE: tech/hugo.md
   :HUGO_DATE: [2017-02-09 Thu 21:43]
   :END:
**ã€€hugo.elã€€
    ....

**ã€€theme
    ....

export

M-x hugo

check

$ hugo server --theme=hpstr --buildDrafts --watch

http://127.0.0.1:1313

deploy

deploy.sh

#!/bin/bash

rm -rf public/post/*

hugo -t hpstr

cd public

git add -A
git commit -m "Update public files"
git push

item.title: RubyMotion
item.description:
Welcome to RubyMotion http://www.rubymotion.com/developer-center/guides/getting-started/

$ sudo motion update

motion –version

Hello World

$ motion create Hello

Sample

https://github.com/HipByte/RubyMotionSamples

Developer Center

http://www.rubymotion.com/developer-center/

http://tutorial.rubymotion.jp/

Rakefile

ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆã®è¨­å®šã¯Rakefileã«æ›¸ãã‚‰ã—ã„ã€‚

ãƒ‘ã‚¹ã®è¨­å®šã‚’ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã£ã½ã„ã€‚ $:.unshift(“/Library/RubyMotion/lib”)

frameworks

app.frameworks += [‘AVFoundation’] ãƒ‡ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ«ãƒˆå€¤ã¯ [“UIKit”, “Foundation”, “CoreGraphics”] ã§ã™ã€‚

ios

UIViewController

microphone input

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4239073/how-to-listen-to-mic-input-and-analyse-in-real-time

aurioTouch2ã¨ã„ã†ã‚µãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ ãŒã‚ã‚‹ Remote IOã¨ã„ã†ã®ã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‚‰ã—ã„ã€‚

Core Audio ã®ä¸­ã«Audio UnitãŒã‚ã‚‹ã€‚

å®Ÿæ©Ÿ

rake device

ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒ¡ãƒ¢

ã“ã‚Œã§ãƒ­ã‚°ãŒå‡ºã›ã‚‹ã‚‰ã—ã„ã€‚ puts “Hello again!”

Read-Eval-Print-Loop (REPL)

Auto Layout

Visual Format ã¨ã„ã†è¨˜æ³•ãŒç”¨æ„ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ RM ã«ã¯ãã®Visual Formatã‚’ãƒ©ãƒƒãƒ—ã—ãŸ motion-layout ã¨ã„ã† Gem ãŒã‚ã‚‹

Visual Format

Motion::Layout.new do |layout|
  layout.view self.view
  layout.metrics height: 120
  layout.subviews yellow: @yellowView
  layout.vertical   "[yellow(height)]|"
  layout.horizontal "|[yellow]|"
end

Motion::Layout.new do |layout|
  layout.view @yellowView
  layout.subviews red: @redView,  blue: @blueView
  layout.vertical   "|-[red]-|"
  layout.vertical   "|-[blue]-|"
  layout.horizontal "|-[red]-[blue(==red)]-|"
end
